Interface Board

All Known Implementing Classes:
SimpleBoard
public interface Board
Interface defining the contract for the game board. Provides methods for managing brick movement, rotation, collision detection, row clearing, and game state management.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    ClearRow
    clearRows()
    Clears completed rows from the board and returns information about the cleared rows.
    boolean
    createNewBrick()
    Creates a new brick at the spawn position.
    int[][]
    getBoardMatrix()
    Gets the current state of the game board matrix.
    int
    getGhostY()
    Gets the y-coordinate where the ghost piece should be displayed.
    Score
    getScore()
    Gets the Score object associated with this board.
    ViewData
    getViewData()
    Gets the view data containing information about the current brick, its position, ghost piece position, and upcoming bricks.
    void
    hardDrop()
    Performs a hard drop, moving the current brick to its lowest possible position instantly.
    void
    mergeBrickToBackground()
    Merges the current falling brick into the background board.
    boolean
    moveBrickDown()
    Attempts to move the current falling brick down by one cell.
    boolean

    Attempts to move the current falling brick left by one cell.
    boolean
    moveBrickRight()
    Attempts to move the current falling brick right by one cell.
    void
    newGame()
    Resets the board to start a new game.
    boolean
    rotateLeftBrick()
    Attempts to rotate the current falling brick counter-clockwise.

  • Method Details

    • moveBrickDown

      boolean moveBrickDown()
      Attempts to move the current falling brick down by one cell.
      Returns:
      true if the brick was moved successfully, false if blocked

    • moveBrickLeft

      boolean moveBrickLeft()
      Attempts to move the current falling brick left by one cell.
      Returns:
      true if the brick was moved successfully, false if blocked

    • moveBrickRight

      boolean moveBrickRight()
      Attempts to move the current falling brick right by one cell.
      Returns:
      true if the brick was moved successfully, false if blocked

    • rotateLeftBrick

      boolean rotateLeftBrick()
      Attempts to rotate the current falling brick counter-clockwise.
      Returns:
      true if the rotation was successful, false if blocked

    • createNewBrick

      boolean createNewBrick()
      Creates a new brick at the spawn position.
      Returns:
      true if a new brick was created successfully, false if the spawn position is blocked (game over)

    • getBoardMatrix

      int[][] getBoardMatrix()
      Gets the current state of the game board matrix.
      Returns:
      a 2D array representing the board state (0 = empty, non-zero = filled cell)

    • getViewData

      ViewData getViewData()
      Gets the view data containing information about the current brick, its position, ghost piece position, and upcoming bricks.
      Returns:
      ViewData object containing all rendering information

    • mergeBrickToBackground

      void mergeBrickToBackground()
      Merges the current falling brick into the background board. Called when the brick can no longer move down.

    • clearRows

      ClearRow clearRows()
      Clears completed rows from the board and returns information about the cleared rows.
      Returns:
      ClearRow object containing information about cleared rows and score bonus

    • getScore

      Score getScore()
      Gets the Score object associated with this board.
      Returns:
      the Score instance for tracking points

    • newGame

      void newGame()
      Resets the board to start a new game. Clears the board and resets the score.

    • hardDrop

      void hardDrop()
      Performs a hard drop, moving the current brick to its lowest possible position instantly.

    • getGhostY

      int getGhostY()
      Gets the y-coordinate where the ghost piece should be displayed. The ghost piece indicates where the current brick will land.
      Returns:
      the y-coordinate (row) for the ghost piece
